Airlift API Documentation

Airlift is an open web framework for building restful web applications using functional JavaScript on Google App Engine.


Users new to Airlift should check out the manual to get started. This API should help to clarify functions and assist the user as he writes his applications. The Airlift API provides method signatures, descriptions, working code examples and more for each available function in Airlift.

Color coded labels denote the stability of the function and tells in which version the function was added. The stability index is given as follows:


Experimental: This function is newly released. It may be changed or removed in the future. Feedback on this function would be greatly appreciated.
Stable: This is a fully supported and robustly tested function. Future versions of Airlift will strive to maintain backwards compatibility.
Unstable: This function may still be subject to revisions.
Deprecated: This function will be removed in future versions of Airlift. Backwards compatibility should not be expected. Avoiding futher usage is highly recommended.

This project is hosted on Github.

The PDF of this documentation can be downloaded here.
